title: White-breasted nuthatch
summary: The white-breasted nuthatch (Sitta carolinensis) is a small songbird of the nuthatch family common across much of temperate North America. It is stocky, with a large head, short tail, powerful bill, and strong feet.  It has a black cap, white face, chest, and flanks, blue-gray upperparts, and a chestnut lower belly.  Its nine subspecies differ mainly in the color of the body plumage.
